medical: CC: Fall with questionable associated loss of consciousness. HX: This 81 y/o RHM fell down 20 steps on the evening of admission, 1/10/93, while attempting to put his boots on at the top of the staircase. He was evaluated locally and was amnestic to the event at the time of examination. A HCT scan was obtained and he was transferred to UIHC, Neurosurgery. MEDS: Lasix 40mg qd, Zantac 150mg qd, Lanoxin 0.125mg qd, Capoten 2.5mg bid, Salsalate 750mg tid, ASA 325mg qd, "Ginsana" (Ginseng) 100mg bid. PMH: 1)Atrial fibrillation, 2)Right hemisphere stroke, 11/22/88, with associated left hemiparesis and amaurosis fugax. This was followed by a RCEA, 12/1/88 for 98% stenosis. The stroke symptoms/signs resolved. 3)DJD, 4)Right TKR 2-3 years ago, 5)venous stasis; with no h/o DVT, 6)former participant in NASCET, 7)TURP for BPH. No known allergies. FHX: Father died of an MI at unknown age, Mother died of complications of a dental procedure. He has one daughter who is healthy. SHX: Married. Part-time farmer. Denied tobacco/ETOH/illicit drug use. EXAM: BP157/86, HR100 and irregular, RR20, 36.7C, 100%SaO2 MS: A&O to person, place, time. Speech fluent and without dysarthria. CN: Pupils 3/3 decreasing to 2/2 on exposure to light. EOM intact. VFFTC. Optic disks were flat. Face was symmetric with symmetric movement. The remainder of the CN exam was unremarkable. Motor: 5/5 strength throughout with normal muscle tone and bulk. Sensory: unremarkable. Coord: unremarkable. Station/Gait: not mentioned in chart. Reflexes: symmetric. Plantar responses were flexor, bilaterally. Gen Exam: CV:IRRR without murmur. Lungs: CTA. Abdomen: NT, ND, NBS. HEENT: abrasion over the right forehead. Extremity: distal right leg edema/erythema (just above the ankle). tender to touch. COURSE: 1/10/93, (outside)HCT was reviewed, It revealed a left parietal epidural hematoma. GS, PT/PTT, UA, and CBC were unremarkable. RLE XR revealed a fracture of the right lateral malleolus for which he was casted. Repeat HCTs showed no change in the epidural hematoma and he was discharged home on DPH.
layman:
**Chief Complaint:**  
The patient fell and may have lost consciousness.

**History of Present Illness:**  
An 81‑year‑old man fell down 20 steps on the evening of his admission (January 10, 1993) while trying to put on his boots at the top of the stairs. He was examined at a local hospital and did not remember the fall. A head CT scan was done and he was sent to the University of Illinois Hospital & Health Sciences Center for neurosurgery.

**Medications:**  
- Lasix 40 mg once daily  
- Zantac 150 mg once daily  
- Lanoxin 0.125 mg once daily  
- Capoten 2.5 mg twice daily  
- Salsalate 750 mg three times daily  
- Aspirin 325 mg once daily  
- “Ginsana” (ginseng) 100 mg twice daily  

**Past Medical History:**  
1. Atrial fibrillation  
2. Right‑hemisphere stroke on November 22, 1988 that caused weakness on the left side and brief vision loss; the stroke symptoms went away.  
3. 98 % blockage of the right carotid artery treated with a stent on December 1, 1988.  
4. Degenerative joint disease (arthritis)  
5. Right knee replacement 2–3 years ago  
6. Venous stasis, no history of deep‑vein thrombosis  
7. Participated in the NASCET study (a stroke study)  
8. Transurethral resection of the prostate for enlarged prostate  

No known drug allergies.

**Family History:**  
Father died of a heart attack at an unknown age.  
Mother died from complications after a dental procedure.  
He has one healthy daughter.

**Social History:**  
Married, works part‑time as a farmer.  
Does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.

**Physical Examination (at admission):**  
- Blood pressure 157/86 mm Hg  
- Heart rate 100 bpm, irregular rhythm  
- Respiratory rate 20/min  
- Temperature 36.7 °C (98 °F)  
- Oxygen saturation 100 % on room air  

**Mental Status:**  
Alert and oriented to person, place, and time.  
Speech fluent, no slurred speech.  

**Neurologic Exam:**  
- Pupils equal, 3 mm, react to light.  
- Eye movements normal.  
- No facial weakness; face symmetrical.  
- Motor strength 5/5 in all limbs; normal tone and bulk.  
- Sensation normal.  
- Coordination normal.  
- Reflexes symmetrical; plantar responses flexor on both feet.  

**Other Systems:**  
- Heart: irregular rhythm, no murmurs.  
- Lungs: clear.  
- Abdomen: normal, no pain or tenderness.  
- Head/Neck: small abrasion on right forehead.  
- Right lower leg: swelling and redness just above the ankle, tender to touch.  

**Course:**  
On January 10, 1993, the outside CT scan showed a left parietal epidural hematoma. Blood tests (PT, PTT, urinalysis, CBC) were normal. X‑ray of the right lower leg showed a fracture of the right lateral malleolus; a cast was applied. Repeat CT scans showed no change in the hematoma. He was discharged home on day 2.
